p:
Neuropathological examination revealed
Severe inflammatory lesions.
Demyelinating lesions with marked intraparenchymal and perivascular infiltration by macrophages and T-lymphocytes.
In some cases, abundant viral proliferation was identified by immunocytochemistry or in situ hybridization, but in others the infectious agent could only be detected using PCR.
T-lymphocytes were predominantly CD8(+).
In those cases with the more favorable course, inflammation was less severe with marked macrophage activation and a number of CD4(+) lymphocytes.
In the lethal cases, inflammation was severe and mostly composed of CD8(+) cytotoxic lymphocytes.
